The '1st Fighter Wing (1 FW)' is a United States Air Force unit assigned to the
Air Combat Command Ninth Air Force. It is stationed at Langley Air Force Base,
Va. where it is a tenant unit, being supported by the 633rd Air Base Wing.

Its 1st Operations Group (1 OG) is a successor organization of the '1st Fighter
Group', one of the 15 original combat air groups formed by the Army before World
War II. The 1 OG the oldest major air combat unit in the United States Air
Force, its origins formed on 5 May 1918.

The wing was initially part of Tactical Air Command being formed at March Field,
California in 1947 and was one of the first wings to be equipped with the North
American F-86 Sabre in February 1949. Briefly a part of Strategic Air Command in
1949, it was reassigned to Air Defense Command in 1950 and provided air defense
of the Upper Midwest of the United States until being reassigned to Tactical Air
Command in 1970. The 1 FW was the first operational wing equipped with the F-
15A/B Eagle in 1976; and in 2005, was the first operational wing equipped with
the F-22A Raptor air superiority stealth fighter.

The commander of the 1st Fighter Wing is
[http://www.langley.af.mil/library/biographies/bio.asp?bioID=12296 Col. Kevin J
Robbins]. The Command Chief Master Sergeant is
[http://www.langley.af.mil/library/biographies/bio.asp?id=12928 Chief Master
Sgt. Kevin J. Jurgella].
